page.title: 19Shipley Mill/Hilaire Belloc
page.content: Built 1879 for Â£2500, the youngest and biggest smock mill in Sussex passed into ownership of Belloc in 1906 when he bought Kings Land, built on Templar 12th C. foundations. Little changed since the 18th C.,house guests include Winston Churchill, G.K.Chesterton and possibly Edward II. Mr."Bunny" Bennett of Coolham worked for Powells, millers , from 14 yrs (5s for 48hr.wk.) to retiremement and vividly recalls work in the Mill. After Belloc's death 1953 the Mill was repaired and a memorial plaque sited. In 1979 celebrations marked the Mill's centenary.A local custodian for the Mill, now owned by Hilaire Belloc's descendants, arranges public open days (adult 50p child 20p). Preserved by The Friends of Shipley Windmill and backed by West Sussex County Council, Â£50,000 is still needed for essential repairs.
